title: (x) Everbloom logo - Kravitz Thermal {Stephen}
content:
I’ve seen this type around a few times...what is it called? Also, if you guys have any suggestions for beautiful upper/lower fonts, I’d love to hear those too.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20070629151842im_/http:/typophile.com/files/everbloom.jpg)

 [‹ (x) "Die falschen Teilnehmer" squarish sans - Nuri {Urban One}](http://web.archive.org/web/20070629151842/http:/typophile.com/node/18445 "Go to previous forum topic") [Mutabor Eagle-like logo ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070629151842/http:/typophile.com/node/19184 "Go to next forum topic")
author: letsgobuffs

comments.content:
That may not be a “unicase” font but rather could be a logo basedon an existing font.  
You can find other unicase fonts here

[http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=unicase](http://web.archive.org/web/20070629151842/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=unicase "http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=unicase")

Your font reminds me of Chalet Paris 1960 at House Industries but for the tail on the R and the m. Also shades of Avant Garde.

It’s likely they used [Kravitz Thermal](http://web.archive.org/web/20070629151842/http:/www.dafont.com/font.php?file=kravitz&page=1&nb_ppp_old=50&text=everbloom&nb_ppp=50&classt=alpha) by Ben Belvanz which I’ll bet is based on some custom lettering from a Kravtiz album.

The font isn’t one of Ben’s better attempts. That m is a mess. An alternative is [Futura Maxi](http://web.archive.org/web/20070629151842/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=4&displayfontid=C.106298.0.0&fontRendererText=everbloom) whose super high x-height should make the unicasing an easier task.
great! Thank you both very much!
